name: ITP approved for use by: Jon De Castro
Acceptance Criteria - 40MPa min strength grout or approved equivalent to be used to fill lifting anchor recesses post installation.
Acceptance Criteria - 10mm THK x 100mm wide continuous elastomeric bearing strip to bond to beam flange prior to installation of precast barriers.
2.3 - Precast Barrier Brackets, M16 4.6/S bolts with nuts and washers, 5mm/10mm glav shim plates
Acceptance Criteria - Bespoke brackets to suit flange width as per IFC drawings to be inslatted in contact with the underside of the beam flange.
2.4 - Hold Down Bracket - M20 Nuts, Tapered Plates, 150 x 32mm thick plate Gr350

Acceptance Criteria - M20 nuts, tapered washers and plates to be installed as part of the assembly of the hold down brackates of precast barriers connection into the precast beams in accordance to IFC drawings.
Acceptance Criteria - Precast supplier is required to provide the following Quality Assurance documentation for each element, typically this consists of:
i. Certificate of Compliance / Birth Certificate
These documents are typically stored in a MDR Lot in Team Binder.
Verifying Documents - This ITP Signed Off
Acceptance Criteria - Check the revision of the IFC drawings are current as per the drawing register (on Teambinder)
Frequency - Prior to starting Works and at regular intervals
Verifying Documents - This ITP Signed Off
Acceptance Criteria - Survey activities undertaken to ensure and validate that all Works meet level and location requirements within the tolerances.
○ Where anchor bolts are cast in to the concrete, ensure that these are within tolerance.
○ If the precast elements are being connected with a stitch pour, mark any clashes from protruding reinforcement with the planned locations from the precast.
Note: Any clashes should be levered out of the way using a crow-bar or similar - avoid hitting with a hammer on bars with a tight radius.
Verifying Documents - This ITP Signed Off
Acceptance Criteria - Roughened surface means concrete surface shall be roughned as construction joint in accordance with IFC drawings and VR Section 610.
Verifying Documents - This ITP Signed Off
Reference - IFC Drawings Section 620.07 Crane Lift Study
Acceptance Criteria - Unless otherwise specified, precast elements shall be lifted using approved lifting points in accordance with the Crane Lift Study and Precast Beams Certified Lifting Design.
Verifying Documents - This ITP Signed Off

Acceptance Criteria - Precast kerbs shall be placed onto position and orientation and not released from the crane until sufficiently braced or restrained by bolted connection, in accordance with the approved temporary works design and/or IFC drawings.
○ Precast barrier brackets installed as per IFC Drawings.
○ The nominal gap between precast elements is as per the IFC Drawings.
Verifying Documents - This ITP Signed Off
5.3 - Hold-Down Bracket Fastener Tightening - Snug Tight Condition (4.6/S)

Acceptance Criteria - Place washers, nuts, and plates onto the embedded thread as detailed on the IFC Drawings. Tighten with a few impacts of an impact wrench or the full effort of a person using a podger spanner. Protrusion to be at least 1 clear thread shows beyond the nut but no greater than 12mm.
Frequency - Where applicable, each bolted connection
Verifying Documents - This ITP Signed Off
Acceptance Criteria - All manufactured precast elements shall be traced from the completion of manufacture to their final location by a unique identification number.
Record: The final location of each precast element, showing individual ID and date installed.
Attach: Lot Maps showing beam individual IDs
Verifying Documents - This ITP Signed Off
Reference - IFC Drawings Section 610.47 VR Table 610.472
Acceptance Criteria - Provide record of dimensional measurements to demonstrate concrete members comply with specified tolerances.
Verifying Documents - This ITP Signed Off
Acceptance Criteria - MRPA Quality Management Plan
Frequency - Once, prior to closure of this lot / element / Work area
Verifying Documents - This ITP Signed Off

On behalf of Metropolitan Roads Program Alliance, it is hereby certified that the Works represented by the item of work listed have been tested in accordance with the Project Quality Plan and conform in all respects with the requirements of the Contract.
